definition: to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.english: He should not had embarked on that he saw to be a path of no return in the first place.
sentences.chinese: 从一开始，他就不该踏上这条没有归途的道路。

sentences.english: A Braavosi trading galley called at Pentos on her way back from the Jade Sea.
sentences.chinese: 一艘布拉佛斯商船在从翡翠海的归途中在潘托斯休整。

sentences.english: Now they are on their way back.
Dalingha, the return way of human, it possibly is the time folded inch by inch.
sentences.chinese: 德令哈，人的归途，大概就是一寸一寸折起的光阴。

sentences.english: Our life is a long way which cannot see the end and have no homeward journey.
sentences.chinese: 我们的生命是一段看不到终点也没有归途的长路。

sentences.english: On the way back, they stopped at an old mosque which was being renovated.
sentences.chinese: 归途中，他们在一座正在翻修的清真寺前停下。

sentences.english: On the way back pilar questions maria and jordan about their romance.
sentences.chinese: 归途中，皮拉尔向玛丽亚和乔丹询问他俩的恋情。

sentences.english: On the way back, we talked about the pleasure of the country people and the pain of the farmers.
sentences.chinese: 在归途中，我们讨论到只在乡下的快乐和农夫的苦处。

sentences.english: On my way home, I pondered what Li had said.
sentences.chinese: 宴毕后，在归途中，我反思刚才老李那一番话。

sentences.english: Discovery undocks from the space station Sunday for the two-day journey home.
sentences.chinese: “发现号”将于星期日脱离空间站踏上两天的归途。

definition: foreign land/a place far from home
foreign land/away from one's native place
to leave (on a long journey)/to part from sb
to diverge from the main road, also figuratively
